title: Red Sox reportedly place reliever Jordan Hicks on IL after latest implosion
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox place reliever Jordan Hicks on 15-day IL due to a shoulder injury before game against Arizona.
Hicks struggled in a recent game, not recording an out and allowing four runs, leading to a 7-0 deficit.
Hicks holds an 8.20 ERA over 21 appearances and is under contract for $12 million per year until 2027.

title: Derrick White gets candid about ‘different’ season that awaits Celtics
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Derrick White discusses the Celtics' transition after losing three of five starters, including Jayson Tatum due to injury.
Boston traded Jrue Holiday and Kristaps Porzingis to address luxury-tax issues, impacting team depth for the 2025-26 season.
Despite roster changes, White sees motivation in being underestimated, citing a talent-rich team and strong coaching staff.

title: Report of suspicious man approaching Arlington child ‘unfounded,’ police say
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Arlington Police closed investigation of alleged child approach by masked man, calling the report 'unfounded.'
An 11-year-old boy reported a masked man attempted to grab him on Waldo Road, Arlington, on Tuesday.
Police Chief Julie Flaherty stated insufficient evidence was found following witness interviews and surveillance review.

title: Man who threatened pro-Palestinian protesters in Cambridge facing assault charge
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Matthew Freeman of North Billerica charged with assault and civil rights violation after allegedly threatening protesters with a hatchet.
Incident occurred during an August 10 'Rise Up for Gaza' march organized by the Palestinian Youth Movement in Cambridge.
Freeman allegedly drove a Black Audi and struck a protester with a car door while threatening to kill participants.

title: Patriots’ Will Campbell lands on injury report ahead of season opener
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Rookie left tackle Will Campbell is listed as a limited participant in practice due to an ankle injury.
Cornerback Christian Gonzalez has not practiced since July 28, missing practice due to a hamstring injury.
Defensive tackle Christian Barmore participated in practice but with limited reps not related to an injury.

title: Invasive seaweed stinks up one of the North Shore’s favorite seaside spots
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Invasive Japanese seaweed, heterosiphonia japonica, is decomposing at Good Harbor Beach in Gloucester, emitting a rotten egg odor.
Hurricane Erin's winds washed large amounts of the seaweed ashore, preventing it from returning to sea.
First found in Rhode Island in 2008, the seaweed now extends from Nova Scotia to Long Island's southern coast.

title: Police: Suspect caused ATM explosion in Woburn, prompting FBI investigation
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: A suspect caused an ATM explosion Thursday at an Eastern Bank on Mishawaun Road in Woburn.
The FBI and State Police Bomb Squad are investigating the use of a pipe bomb or similar device.
The suspect fled the scene and remains at large, but no injuries were reported, according to police.

title: Canton man arrested in Dorchester murder
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Jordan Evans, 32, was arrested in Canton for the May 3 murder of Shakar Caterson in Dorchester.
Caterson, 35, was shot near Blue Hill Avenue and Georgia Street and died at a hospital.
Evans faces charges including murder and firearm violations; arraignment set in Roxbury Municipal Court.

title: New England governors back wind energy as Trump escalates his attacks on industry
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Five New England governors, including Maura Healey, urge the Trump Administration to support ongoing offshore wind projects.
President Trump suspended new federal offshore wind leasing, affecting projects like Revolution Wind off Connecticut and Rhode Island.
Governors argue wind projects boost American jobs and economy, opposing Trump's efforts to halt them, such as reconsidering SouthCoast Wind in Massachusetts.

title: Read a statement from the fiancé of Shrewsbury father shot and killed after walking son to school
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Kevin Doherty, 56, was killed on August 28 in Shrewsbury after dropping his son at Calvin Coolidge Elementary School.
Doherty was allegedly shot by Snehal A. Srivastava, 26, who was reportedly spray painting graffiti on a sidewalk.
A vigil and fundraiser in memory of Doherty is scheduled for October 11 at SAC Park in Shrewsbury.
